alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 5:29PM EDT until May 26 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in JACKSON KY has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bell County in southeastern Kentucky... East central Knox County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain is estimated to have already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pineville, Middlesboro, East Pineville, Wallsend, Varilla, Ponza, Beverly, Stony Fork Junction, Black Snake, Field, Erose and Straight Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
